instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
hello,

Battery is not installed. It draws 0.11 amps, then enters a continuous loop drawing 0.0 amps like this.

The <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> voltage fluctuates between 5V intermittently. It consistently behaves in this manner.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H_LDO</SIGNAL> :5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>: 5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Do you note voltage pulse on other coils?
Check diode mode to ground on all secondaryy power supplies.

Any history available?
Did you test the board alone on the desk?

Be aware, all these boards end with dead CPU.
You may fix power problem and client comes back later with dead CPU claiming for warranty!
